Are you ready to make a change? Are you ready to take healthcare to the next level? Then it’s time to join the nation’s leading medical practice association - MGMA.

Here is what you can expect when you join our team:
Competitive pay
Insurance benefits & matching 401k
3 weeks’ vacation
Tuition assistance
On-site fitness center
Volunteer opportunities
About the Role

The Data Solutions department currently has an exciting opportunity for an Jr. Data Analyst to join their team. The Jr. Data Analyst will be responsible for assisting in the verification of data used to produce nationally recognized health care survey products. Duties for this position will include working collaboratively on cross functional teams to review questionnaires, reports, and tools; edit data, interface with customers, prepare survey related mailings, and research product usage and satisfaction. The position will have the opportunity to be involved in exciting projects and work in a great team environment! The ideal Jr. Data Analyst has a passion for learning, works well independently and as a team, and enjoys providing excellent customer service!

Responsibilities
Aid in survey project development.
Provide daily customer support for survey and data product inquiries via phone path and email.
Edit and verify data on returned survey questionnaires, contact survey respondents to verify reported information when needed.
Review and update survey products on MGMA store.
Monitor Member Communities for member generated questions, content and tools and provide feedback for team discussion at daily standups.
Participate in the promotion and marketing of survey participation.
Review and update survey products on MGMA store and web.
Continually monitor and report participation for each survey cycle by reviewing the results and effectiveness of marketing/RE tactics through Eloqua.
Develop and distribute educational materials for surveys and data products.
Participate in review and testing of survey platform, reports, and tools.
Audit process documentation, verify processes with team, and update as necessary.
About You
Bachelor’s Degree in health or business administration, psychology, sociology, statistics, quantitative methods or related field.
1-2 years of experience in health care or business administration, survey research, marketing research or related field.
Exhibits understanding of descriptive statistics.
Knowledge of survey design, sampling, evaluation, and assessment a plus.
Strong skills in Microsoft Office Suite.
About MGMA

Medical Group Management Association (MGMA) is the premier association for professionals who lead medical practice. Since 1926, through data, people, insights, and advocacy, MGMA empowers medical group practices to innovate and create meaningful change in healthcare. With a membership of more than 40,000 medical practice administrators, executives, and leaders, MGMA represents more than 12,500 organizations of all sizes, types, structures and specialties that deliver almost half of the healthcare in the United States.

View all MGMA's open career opportunities here: www.mgma.com/about/careers.

Why TrueAccord?

Debt collection is failing consumers. Every year, 77 Million Americans have negative experiences with the collections process, and they deserve a better approach - one that is more relevant, more digital, and less abrasive. That’s why banks, lenders, and industry leaders are coming to TrueAccord for innovative solutions recovering outstanding receivables.

TrueAccord is a category-defining company. We combine machine learning with a human based approach to assist both clients and consumers through a challenging financial process. With a world-class leadership team, passionate and driven team members, and a diverse and growing client base, TrueAccord is well positioned for continued success. Come join our team and disrupt a multi-billion dollar industry that’s been waiting for change.

The Role

TrueAccord’s Analytics team is responsible for driving our business forward with data. The Data Analyst will join a team of highly motivated people who take the TrueAccord mission seriously and are determined to succeed. The core objective of this role is the development and delivery of analyses to cultivate TrueAccord’s strategies and maximize client performance.

As a Data Analyst, you will take an active role in highly complex/sensitive projects, using data and behavioral analytics to intimately understand the debtor population and what levers will affect cohort performance. You will conduct deep explorations into our data to identify trends, produce insights, and build predictive capabilities. You will gather key insights around our product, operations, and performance, and will deliver these to stakeholders to enable informed decision making. This is an exciting, high-profile role that has significant impact on TrueAccord and is integral to the company's success.
Responsibilities
Use applied and behavioral analytics to analyze performance trends and optimize strategy execution.
Conduct root cause analyses to identify and understand key performance drivers.
Produce accountability for business outcomes through KPI creation and monitoring.
Develop forecast models to predict key production drivers and future performance, ensuring accuracy of longer-term strategy views.
Create metrics to track and improve operational efficiency and productivity.
Establish quantitative relationships between production levels and performance to enable opportunity sizing and scenario planning.
Deliver ad-hoc analytical support or reporting using a variety of concepts, practices, and data sources.
Routinely interact with key stakeholders to present performance information or findings from any assigned analyses.
Manage large amounts of data to develop solutions.
Ensure data integrity through the development and use of system controls.
Requirements
A minimum of 2 years of experience using quantitative data analysis to solve problems and drive performance is required
BS/MS degree in an analytical discipline: finance, statistics, physics, applied mathematics, computer science, information systems, engineering, etc.
Ability to build complex models, perform deep analyses, and turn raw data into useful information
A deep understanding of statistical analysis, modeling, experiment design, and common pitfalls of data analysis
Fluency in SQL
Ability to drill into root causes and answer not only “Why” but also “So What”
Ability to present complex information and deliver insights to business partners clearly and concisely
Attention to detail and accuracy, while maintaining a solid awareness of the big picture, are extremely important
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively, both in a team environment and across operational groups
Must be able to work effectively with little direct supervision and in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities, and multiple deadlines
Nice to Have
Experience in Financial Services industry--with bonus points coming from relevant experience in the debt collections space
Experience with scenario planning (i.e., “What if” analyses), including the successful use of assumptions in place of key data points
Ability to use data-driven insights to influence process improvements.
Competency with data visualization or business intelligence tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Familiarity with a statistical language such as R or Python.
What TrueAccord offers you + Culture & Benefits

TrueAccord is headquartered in San Francisco and opened a new office in Lenexa, KS in April 2019. We offer a healthy work environment that continuously builds an inclusive & diverse culture where everyone is able to develop the best version of themselves. We are a dynamic group of people who are subject matter experts with a passion for change (and a strong Giphy game).

We promote work/life harmony and increased productivity. Company events are held for all our teams to come together, have fun and learn about one another.

Our teams are crafting solutions to big problems every day. If you’re looking for an opportunity to do impactful work, join TrueAccord and make a difference.


Our Dedication to Diversity & Inclusion

TrueAccord is an equal opportunity employer. We promote, value, and thrive with a diverse & inclusive team. Different perspectives contribute to better solutions and this make us stronger every day. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Title: Senior Staff Data Scientist, Applied AI - Visa Research
Job Description:
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Visa Research conducts foundational and applied research on the most challenging problems in the payment industry and provides technical thought leadership for the company’s future. Applied AI team focusing on applying cutting-edge AI technology and create business impact to Visa.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Applied AI team in Visa Research is seeking a Senior Staff Data Scientist. This position will report to the Sr. Director of the Applied AI team. In this role, you will play a crucial role in leading projects, collaborating with multiple teams, and delivering solutions with business impact to Visa.

This role will interact with different stake holders, senior executives, research scientists, software engineers and architects, as well as external parties like merchants, financial institutes and senior directors in business team. You will discover opportunities, propose AI based solutions, create project plan, identify KPIs. You will also work closely with product engineers to deploy the solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Solves unique and complex problems and projects to apply artificial intelligence to Visa’s network and solve pain points for our clients
Contributes multiple projects to achieve objectives, deliver innovative technologies, insights and products to Visa business units resolving significant product pain-points and create new growth opportunities
Drives progress despite ambiguity & ability to identify blockers ahead of time.
Identifies key KPIs and create SMART goals
Requires expertise in both Big Data and Deep Learning to carry out specific professional level work within a function, business unit or geography
Designs AI solution (model and implementation) specific to the problem at hand with limited guidance
Full accountability to deliver across team projects spanning multiple domains.
Collaborate across Visa with different teams, business units, software engineering, research scientists & architects
Identifies opportunities in current products/services that can be addressed using AI
Influence, design AI components and execute the development of identified opportunities.
Identifies synergies & leverage them across solutions.
Work with product development (engineering) to ensure deployment of solutions. Deliver prototypes and production code based on need.
Contributes to development of functional strategy and recommend product or service improvement
Stays current in new technologies and champions testing them.
Operates with limited guidance in a complex environment
Delivers business interpretation of results to product and business teams. Put together material to present the solution to business partners.
Understands the product, project and technologies. Strategical thinking on how a product fits with the rest of Visa’s ML and AI offerings.
Basic Qualifications
PhD degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, mathematics, or equivalent field with a focus on Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Data Mining, Statistical or other mathematical analysis.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong knowledge of machine learning and deep learning:
Extensive experience with different Deep Learning structures like RNN, CNN etc
Experience with TensorFlow is a plus
Strong understanding of algorithms and data structures
Strong knowledge of Big Data:
Extensive experience with Big Data tools like MapReduce, Hive and Spark
Daily work experience with large datasets with trillions of records
Strong programming skills such as Python, Scala, and Java
Advanced understanding of Visa Datasets is a plus
Expertise in implementing algorithms published in research papers and developing customized algorithms
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience in creation of efficient & resilient AI pipelines to put solutions to production
Knowledge of more than one business/functional area
Experience in payments or related industry is a plus
Publications or presentation in recognized Machine Learning and Data Mining journals/conferences is a plus.
Travel Requirements This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 5% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.

EEO Statement Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
